result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Voigt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Voigt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Voigt was found guilty of Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).
  • Daniel Voigt was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1).
  • Daniel Voigt was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1).
  • Daniel Voigt was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Court orders conditions of Parole to include costs and restitution.

**5/8/17 - The Court orders that the JOC be amended to reflect that restitution be taken from prison wages only.**

On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Voigt to an indeterminate sentence not to exceed to 8 years.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
--To pay statutory costs

--to pay Restitution in an amount TBD
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee

--The Court allows Mr. Voigt to leave his home for scheduled and emergency medical needs
--The Court requires that Mr. Voigt be in his room and not in any common area, unless otherwise deemed necessary by health care professionals at his care Center, if Mr. Voigt is housed at an assisted living Center.
--No Contact with SCS dob 4/8/1989
--Not Cause anyone else to have contact with SCS
--Not knowingly be present at or within 500 feet of SCS's residence, place of employment while SCS is present or any school while SCS is attending or present of the premises
--Not to communicate verbally or in writing on any medium to anybody any derogatory, demeaning, disparaging, cruel or otherwise hurtful words or statements regarding SCS
--Obtain a psychosexual evaluation by a licensed professional within 90 days and provide a copy of the evaluation to the District Attorney's office within 120 days
--Follow through and complete any treatment, counseling or therapy recommended by psychosexual evaluation. Provide updates on any such treatment, counseling, or therapy to the District Attorney's office in writing at least every 90 days
--Refrain from any further violations of local, state or federal law. Comply with the Implied Contest Law
--Commit no violations of the bail/bond that remains in effect on Count #1

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.


***Per 7-13-2016 Order - Mr. Voigt to leave the facility at least twice a month with another staff person in order to do his personal shopping. At no time will he be left alone***

--To pay 10% restitution surcharge

****1-19-2016 COURT ORDER - Defendant to pay restitution to S.C.S. in the amount of $18,500****

--Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 5% restitution surcharge

***03/04/16: The Court orders that the Defendant pay $32 a month towards restitution; the first payment will be be due by 4/11/16; this is to paid as a condition of Probation. ***

**5/8/17 - The Court orders that the JOC be amended to reflect that restitution be taken from prison wages only.**

Correction to the Record - At the hearing on ability to pay that was held on March 4, 2016 the Court erroneously cited State v Loutsch for the proposition that a total order for restitution can outstrip the defendant's ability to pay restitution during the probationary period. The Court misread its notes. The case that controls (and which overruled that aspect of Loutsch) is State v Fernandez 2009 WI 29

Case called at 10:08am [mo]
Defendant Daniel  Voigt in court with Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance, notes that there is a request to be heard

The Court is presented with an Amended Information 
--ADA Shock gives arguments in support of acceptance of the Amended Information 
--The Court inquires of factual basis of Counts #1, #2, #3, and #4 of the Amended Information, arguments given by Counsel
--The Court accepts the Amended Information

The Charges and Maximum penalties of charges in the Amended Information are recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3, and #4 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty.

As to Count #1 of the Amended Information the Court STAYS entry of the Judgement of Conviction and adopts the Deferred Prosecution Agreement as Proposed.
As to Counts #2, #3, and #4 of the Amended Information the Court orders a Judgement of Conviction be entered.

The parties jointly motion to the Court, to allow the State time to submit a Request for Restitution and that the Court order Restitution in an amount to be determined at sentencing

SCS makes a statement to the Court
ADA Shock gives sentencing arguments
Atty. Van Wagner gives sentencing arguments
recess: 11:13am--reconvene: 11:20am

On Joint Motion of the Parties, The Court reads in and dismisses Count #5 of the Amended Information
On Joint Motion of the Parties, The Court dismisses Counts #6 and #7 of the Amended Information

On Counts #2, #3, and #4 of the Amended Information the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Voigt of Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--On Count #2, to serve 4 months of Home Detention with GPS/Electronic Monitoring
--On Count #3, to serve 4 months of Home Detention with GPS/Electronic Monitoring; this is to be consecutive to the dentention is Count #2
--On Count #4, to serve 4 months of Home Detention with GPS/Electronic Monitoring;this is to be consecutive to the dentention is Count #3
--An exception to the Home Detention would be if Care Wisconsin recommends that Mr. Voigt be in an assisted living Center, and this assisted living Center cannot accommodate the GPS/electronic monitoring, then it will be Home Detention without the electronic monitoring.
--The Court allows Mr. Voigt to leave his home for scheduled and emergency medical needs
--The Court requires that Mr. Voigt be in his room and not in any common area, unless otherwise deemed necessary by health care professionals at his care Center, if Mr. Voigt is housed at an assisted living Center.
--No Contact with SCS dob 4/8/1989
--Not Cause anyone else to have contact with SCS
--Not knowingly be present at or within 500 feet of SCS's residence, place of employment while SCS is present or any school while SCS is attending or present of the premises
--Not to communicate verbally or in writing on any medium to anybody any derogatory, demeaning, disparaging, cruel or otherwise hurtful words or statements regarding SCS
--Obtain a psychosexual evaluation by a licensed professional within 90 days and provide a copy of the evaluation to the District Attorney's office within 120 days
--Follow through and complete any treatment, counseling or therapy recommended by psychosexual evaluation. Provide updates on any such treatment, counseling, or therapy to the District Attorney's office in writing at least every 90 days
--Refrain from any further violations of local, state or federal law. Comply with the Implied Contest Law
--Commit no violations of the bail/bond that remains in effect on Count #1

--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of  $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

Case called at 8:45am[MO]
Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Daniel  Voigt does NOT appear in court.
This case is scheduled today for Shiffra Motion Hearing.
Atty. Van Wagner submits Defendant's exhibit #1, a Waukesha Hospital letter confirming that Mr. Voight was admitted last night. 
Based on the presentation from the Defense, the Court will NOT issue a bench warrant. 
The Court notes that the filing of the Shiffra Motion was less than an hour before the scheduled hearing. 
Atty. Van Wagner seeks leave to file the Shiffra Motion untimely, indicating that an affidavit from Mr. Voight is forthcoming and giving argument in support of the request. 
Recess:8:58-Reconvene 8:59 (for ADA Shock to consult with the alleged victim)
The Court inidcates he will address the necessary sanction to Atty. Van Wagner for untimely submission of the Shiffra Motion at a later date.
Atty. Van Wagner indicates he intends to have the Affadavit filed with the Court by Friday 3/13/15, so long as Mr. Voight is in stable medical condition.
ADA Shock indicates that he does not object to the leave or the Affidavit being filed as soon as possible. 
The Defense should advise the Court and the State by 4:00pm 3/3/15 of the Affidavit or by that date and time a request for an extension for filing, with necessary reasoning. 
The Court requests that the States response be filed by 3/20/15 at 4:00
The Court and Counsel discuss re- scheduling of the Shiffra Motion hearing. 
The Court directs the Clerk to move the already scheduled FSSC, from 1:00 to 3:00 on the same date.
 Atty. Van Wagner requests that the Court hold in abeyance the imposition of any sanction for his untimely filing. 
recess: 9:20am


NEXT: (1) Reschedule both FSSC and Shiffra Motion Hearing 4/21/2015 at 3:00pm (2) The 5/19--5/21/2015 Jury Trial dates remain on the calendar
